page.title: 02Letham Village.
page.content: Letham Village. Most of the houses in Letham are old and are built of stone. There are 67 houses altogether and many of these have been modernised and extended. 3 have been built recently. The majority are terraced but there are also detached and semi-detached houses, flats and bungalows. 14 of the houses are owned by the Regional Council. Most of the rest are owner-occupied. There is a Primary School, Village Hall and a General Shop, Post Office. The Council own a small depot and there is also a Park where children may play safely. Opposite the park is the Police Station. Last year Letham won the Best Kept Village award for North East Fife.
